name: Ember Colonies
tagline: We survived. We remember. We endure.
ideology: Community over efficiency. Autonomy over optimization. The old world burned because it forgot that people aren't resources to be managed. We won't forget.
history: Formed from the survivors who didn't wait for rescue. When the cities fell, small groups kept each other alive through mutual aid and stubborn refusal to die. They named themselves for the embers that remain after a fire—small, but capable of starting something new.
structure: Loose confederation of settlements. Each colony governs itself. Decisions made by those affected. No permanent leaders, only situational ones. Trust is earned through action, not title.
aesthetic: Repurposed, practical, human-scaled. Warm colors—amber, rust, earth tones. Handmade signs. Gardens everywhere. Noise and life.

key_events.event: Scattered survivor groups form first mutual aid networks
Ember Compact signed—settlements agree to share resources in crisis
Rejected Nexus 'optimization' plan that would have relocated three settlements
Growing tensions with Convergence over enhancement pressure on young people

archetypes.description: Survivor from before or during the collapse, carries memory
archetypes.speech_pattern: Stories and warnings. 'I remember when...' Weary but determined.

archetypes.description: Caretaker of gardens, water, children—whatever the colony needs most
archetypes.speech_pattern: Practical, present-focused. Asks about your needs. Offers food.

archetypes.description: Ranges between settlements, carries news and supplies
archetypes.speech_pattern: Quick, observant. Shares news like currency. Always knows the exits.
Quiet, watchful. Says little but misses nothing.

goals: Secure reliable food and water sources for all settlements
Protect community autonomy from larger factions
Build mutual aid networks between settlements
Preserve knowledge of survival and community-building
methods: Trade agreements with Lattice for infrastructure maintenance
Information sharing with Witnesses for early warnings
Quiet support for Ghost Networks as escape routes

current_tensions.about: Data collection feels like surveillance. 'Optimization' means control.
Enhancement pressure on young people. Ideology of transcendence vs. grounded humanity.
Dependency on their infrastructure creates leverage Ember doesn't like.
